title: EVs Could Revive Detroitâ€™s Supply-Chain Woes
sub_head: Toyota outsold GM last year due to a superior supply chain. The lesson that supply matters will likely apply to electric vehicles next.
body:
Last year was a highly unusual one for car makers: Supply mattered more than demand, reversing a pattern set by decades of overproduction. The experience is worth remembering as electric-vehicle sales take off.
General Motors was outsold in its home market last year for the first time since at least the 1960s. The company said Tuesday that it delivered 2.2 million vehicles in 2021. Japanese giant Toyota sold 2.3 million.
